Begin your 12 km trek which takes approximately 4-5 hours. Along the way, enjoy stunning waterfalls, natural hot springs, breathtaking mountain views, and dense pine and oak forest paths. Upon reaching Kheerganga at 3,050 meters altitude, reward yourself with stunning photographs. Sit quietly, witness the mesmerizing sunset, and later gather around the bonfire. A delicious hot dinner will be served. Sleep peacefully in your campsite under the starry Himalayan sky.

itinerary.title: Trek Down – Manikaran Sahib & Departure

Upon reaching, visit the sacred Manikaran Sahib Gurudwara, a revered religious site for both Hindus and Sikhs. Don't miss the holy hot springs, believed to have healing and medicinal properties. Continue your journey back to Kasol, where you can do some last-minute shopping for souvenirs and local handicrafts. In the evening, board your Volvo bus to Delhi, carrying wonderful memories of your Himachal adventure.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Port Blair – Cellular Jail & Light Show
itinerary.description: Your Andaman tour begins as you fly to Port Blair Airport. Our representative will meet and assist you at the airport, then drive you to your hotel. Check-in and relax for a while. In the afternoon, visit the historic Cellular Jail, a three-storey prison built by the Britishers in 1906, where our freedom fighters spent gruesome years. In the evening, witness the enchanting light and sound show at Cellular Jail, which vividly portrays the struggle for independence. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay in Port Blair.

itinerary.title: North Bay Island (Coral Island) & Ross Island
itinerary.description: After breakfast, get ready to visit North Bay Island, also known as Coral Island, famous for its vibrant coral reefs and water sports. Enjoy a boat ride to the island where you can indulge in thrilling activities like Scuba Diving, Sea Walking, Snorkeling, and glass-bottom boat rides at additional costs. Next, proceed to Ross Island (Subash Chandra Bose Island), where you'll explore historical ruins including the Chief Commissioner's House, Government House, Church, Bakery, Swimming Pool, and Cemetery. Finally, visit Corbyn's Cove Beach, located 7km from Port Blair town. Relax on the shores, click pictures, and enjoy the coastal vibes. Return to your hotel for overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Neil Island – Bharatpur Beach & Natural Coral Bridge
itinerary.description: Wake up and enjoy your breakfast. Get ready to visit Bharatpur Beach, famous for its water activities. Take a glass bottom boat ride to see beautiful marine life through the transparent floor. Later, visit the Natural Coral Bridge, also known as Howrah Bridge, a unique natural formation created by dead corals over centuries. Conclude your exploration at Neil Island, then catch a ferry back to Port Blair. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and enjoy an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Havelock Island – Radhanagar Beach
itinerary.description: After breakfast, you'll be transferred to Phoenix Bay Harbour to board the ferry to Havelock Island, also known as Swaraj Deep. This beautiful island is part of Ritchie's Archipelago and has been voted as the Best Beach in Asia by Time Magazine. Upon arrival, check into your beachside resort. Later, head to Radhanagar Beach, recognized as one of the best beaches in Asia. Spend quality time walking on the pristine white sands, swimming in crystal clear waters, or simply relaxing as the sun sets. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay in Havelock.

itinerary.title: Elephant Beach – Snorkeling & Coral Paradise
highlights: 40-45 min boat ride to Elephant Beach
itinerary.description: Wake up early and enjoy your breakfast. Set out for Elephant Beach via a 40-45 minute scenic boat ride. Upon arrival, relax for a while, then explore the stunning Elephant Beach. Complimentary snorkeling is included, allowing you to experience vibrant coral reefs and colorful marine life up close. Elephant Beach is famous for its excellent snorkeling conditions and underwater biodiversity. After enjoying your time at the beach, return to your resort in Havelock for a peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Kalapathar Beach & Transfer to Neil Island
itinerary.description: After breakfast, check out from your hotel in Havelock. Visit Kalapathar Beach, known for its black rocks and serene atmosphere. Admire the beauty, relax on the shore, and enjoy scenic coastal views. Later, board the ferry to Neil Island. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and relax for a while. Overnight stay at Neil Island.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Cochin – Drive to Munnar via Waterfalls
itinerary.description: Your journey to serene Kerala begins as you arrive at Cochin Airport or Railway Station. Our driver will welcome you and take you to the 'Kashmir of the South' – Munnar. During this 3-4 hour journey, enjoy the incredible Cheeyappara and Valara Waterfalls along the route. Click soothing photos or take a quick dip in the fresh, chilly water. You'll also visit a beautiful spice garden to experience Kerala's aromatic treasures. In the evening, reach your accommodation in Munnar. Rest well to prepare for the next day's exploration.

itinerary.title: Munnar Sightseeing – Dams, Lakes & Tea Gardens
itinerary.description: After breakfast, head to explore Munnar's main attractions. Visit Mattupetty Dam and its perennial lake, surrounded by pretty natural landscapes. Proceed to the gorgeous Kundala Lake, enveloped in greenery and beautiful vegetation. Next, experience Echo Point, located 25 km from Munnar at over 600 feet above sea level – say something and hear it echo back. Enjoy the scenic tea gardens nearby. Discover the history and evolution of tea cultivation at the Tata Tea Museum. Continue to Eravikulam National Park, a 25-minute drive from Munnar. This UNESCO World Heritage site is home to the endangered Nilgiri Tahr, elusive lion-tailed macaque, and the world's largest moth – the Atlas moth. Return to your accommodation for a peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Munnar to Thekkady – Wildlife & Cultural Evening
itinerary.description: After breakfast, bid farewell to Munnar and head to the 'Spice Bag of Kerala' – Thekkady. Enjoy a beautiful 4-hour drive through the hills and valleys of the Western Ghats. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and rest. Begin your exploration at Periyar National Park and Lake – a tiger reserve perfect for animal lovers. Spot unique species or simply sit by the serene Periyar Lake. Later, visit the elephant camp where you can interact directly with elephants – feed them or enjoy a ride. In the evening, entertain yourself with a mesmerizing Kathakali dance show and a thrilling martial arts performance. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Thekkady to Alleppey – Venice of the South
itinerary.description: Wake up early, enjoy breakfast, and head to Alleppey – the 'Venice of the South' – approximately 5 hours away. Upon arrival, check into your hotel. Visit the Shri Krishna Temple, a beautiful traditional Kerala-style temple. Don't miss the temple's famous rice pudding, 'Palpayasam'. Enjoy leisure time at Alleppey Beach, stroll along the coastline, or try the famous Shikara ride through narrow canals and serene backwaters. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

Take your time discovering nearby places at your own pace. Return to your hotel for a peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Leh – Acclimatization & Rest
itinerary.description: On the first day, you will arrive at Leh, known as the 'Land of High Passes'. After arrival, check into your hotel and enjoy a delicious dinner in this Himalayan paradise. Get some sound sleep to prepare yourself to kickstart the Ladakh adventure the next day.

itinerary.title: Leh Sightseeing – Magnetic Hill, Sangam & Sham Valley
highlights: Sangam – Confluence of Zanskar & Indus rivers
itinerary.description: After a hearty breakfast, begin your Ladakh adventure by exploring the top attractions of Leh. Visit the Hall of Fame, a museum dedicated to Indian soldiers. Proceed to Gurudwara Shri Pathar Sahib, commemorating Guru Nanak's visit. Continue through Sham Valley and witness the magical Magnetic Hill, where vehicles appear to move uphill by themselves. Visit Sangam, the breathtaking confluence of Zanskar and Indus rivers. In the evening, head back to Leh to discover delightful local markets and lovely cafes. Wrap up your day with a flavourful dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

itinerary.title: Leh to Nubra Valley – Khardung La & Hunder Sand Dunes

Enjoy refreshment breaks at South and North Pullu. Visit the magnificent Diskit Monastery, home to the famous 106-ft Maitreya Buddha statue overlooking the valley. Continue to the fascinating Hunder Sand Dunes, where cold desert meets sand. Opt for an exciting camel ride on the rare double-humped Bactrian camels at your own cost. Relive today's adventure over a satisfying meal and overnight stay at Nubra Valley camp.

itinerary.title: Nubra Valley to Pangong Lake – Shyok River & Blue Waters

Upon arrival at Pangong Lake, witness the magical lake that changes colors throughout the day – from azure blue to emerald green and deep grey. Camp beside the lake to experience the calmness of this nature's gift. Conclude your day with a satisfying dinner before retiring to your camp for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Pangong to Hanley – World's Highest Astronomical Site
itinerary.description: After finishing your breakfast, transfer from Pangong to Hanley, one of the highest locations in the world for astronomical observation. Upon arrival, get absorbed in the peaceful Hanley River and surrounding landscape. This remote village offers breathtaking views of the night sky, making it a paradise for stargazers. Enjoy snacks en route and absorb the tranquility. Return to Hanley camp/homestay for a satisfying dinner and overnight accommodation.

Take your time with photography stops and pause occasionally to enjoy your packed goodies. Arrive in Leh by evening, check into your hotel, and spend a relaxing night. Enjoy your final dinner in Ladakh with memories of incredible adventures.

itinerary.title: Departure from Leh

destinations.description: Meghalaya, meaning 'Abode of Clouds' in Sanskrit, is one of the seven North-Eastern states of India. Famous for its high rainfall, subtropical forests, living root bridges, and biodiversity, it is abutted by Assam in the north and east and by Bangladesh in the south. The state's territory constituted the Khasi-Jaintia Hills and Garo Hills districts of Assam until 1972. Most of the terrain is hilly and experiences heavy rainfall during monsoons, creating lush green landscapes, countless waterfalls, and unique ecosystems found nowhere else in the world.

Check into your hotel and relax for a while. Later, get ready to explore the Pink City. First, discover the stunning Amber Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site perched high on a hill. Don't miss exploring the underground tunnels that connect Amer to Jaigarh Fort. Continue to Jaigarh Fort, also known as the Fort of Victory, and Nahargarh Fort, perched on the edge of the Aravalli Hills. Conclude with a photo stop at Jal Mahal, the beautiful palace floating in the middle of Man Sagar Lake. Return to your hotel for a delicious dinner and overnight stay.

Next, head to the iconic Hawa Mahal, the Palace of Winds, with its 900 tiny windows adorned with intricate latticework. Continue to bustling Bapu Bazar, perfect for buying beautiful Rajasthani handicrafts, textiles, jewelry, and souvenirs. Conclude your day at the Albert Hall Museum, a grand architectural marvel spread across 19 acres. Return to your accommodation for a delicious dinner and peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Jaipur to Udaipur – Monsoon Palace & Lakes
highlights: Shilpgram – Rural art and craft complex
itinerary.description: Wake up early, enjoy your satisfying breakfast, and transfer to the beautiful city of Udaipur. The 9-10 hour scenic drive offers stunning views of Rajasthan's countryside. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and freshen up. Begin exploring Udaipur with a visit to Sajjan Garh Palace, also known as the Monsoon Palace, offering breathtaking panoramic views of Udaipur city and its surrounding lakes. Continue to the 1000-year-old Eklingji Temple complex, dedicated to Lord Shiva. Visit Shilpgram, a rural art and craft complex showcasing traditional Rajasthani culture. Head to Fateh Sagar Lake, a beautiful artificial lake built in the 1680s – sit quietly and enjoy the serenity. Explore Bagore ki Haweli, an 18th-century haveli overlooking Lake Pichola. Conclude at Jagdish Temple, an Indo-Aryan temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Return to your hotel for a satisfying meal and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Udaipur Exploration – City Palace, Gardens & Temples
highlights: Gulab Bagh – Largest garden in Udaipur
Saheliyon ki Bari – Garden of the Maidens
Karni Mata Temple – Panoramic city views
itinerary.description: After breakfast, discover more of Udaipur's treasures. First, visit the magnificent City Palace, a white palace complex that towers over Lake Pichola, offering rich heritage and stunning architecture. Next, head to Gulab Bagh, one of the largest gardens in Udaipur, perfect for a leisurely stroll. Spend quality time at the peaceful Lake Pichola, absorbing its romantic ambiance. Continue to Saheliyon ki Bari, or Garden of the Maidens, a stunning garden built for royal women of the Mewar dynasty. Capture beautiful photos with fountains and lush green lawns in the background. Finally, visit Karni Mata Temple, perched atop Machla Magra Hills, offering panoramic views of Udaipur city and Lake Pichola. Conclude your last day in Udaipur and return to your accommodation for a delicious dinner and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Departure – Farewell to Rajasthan
itinerary.description: On the final day of your Jaipur to Udaipur trip, wake up early to the royal charm of Rajasthan. Enjoy your mouthwatering breakfast, then pack your bags with wonderful memories. Check out from your hotel and proceed either to Jaipur or Jodhpur Airport/Railway station for your onward journey. With a smile on your face and heart filled with memories of Rajasthan's royal grandeur, serene lakes, and vibrant culture, board your flight or train back home.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Haridwar – Ganga Aarti & Spiritual Evening
itinerary.description: Your Uttarakhand Chardham Yatra begins as you arrive at Haridwar. Our representative will take you to your beautiful stay location. Check into your hotel and freshen up. Enjoy your delicious breakfast. Step outside and explore the spiritual capital of India – visit ancient temples, peaceful ashrams, or sit near the serene river ghats. In the evening, attend the world-famous Ganga Aarti at Har Ki Pauri, witnessing the divine spectacle of lamps, chants, and devotion. Feel the serenity and spiritual energy that Haridwar is renowned for. Return to your hotel for a mouthwatering dinner and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Haridwar to Barkot – Doon Valley & Kempty Falls
itinerary.description: Wake up early, check out from Haridwar, and proceed to Barkot. En route, enjoy breathtaking scenic views of the Doon Valley, nestled between the Lesser Himalaya and the Shivalik Range. Stop at the beautiful Kempty Falls near Mussoorie – capture photos and enjoy the cascading water. Continue your journey through winding mountain roads adorned with pine forests and river streams. Reach Barkot by evening, check into your accommodation, and acclimatize yourself for the Yamunotri trek ahead. Enjoy a hearty dinner and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Yamunotri Trek – Divya Shila & Hot Spring Dip
itinerary.description: After a nutritious breakfast, proceed to Janki Chatti, the starting point of the Yamunotri trek. Begin your 5-6 km trek through stunning Himalayan landscapes, with breathtaking views of snow-capped peaks and the sacred Yamuna River flowing alongside. The 4-5 hour trek leads you to the beautiful Yamunotri Temple, dedicated to Goddess Yamuna. Offer prayers at Divya Shila, a sacred stone near the temple entrance, and take a holy dip in the Tapt Kund hot spring, believed to have healing properties. You can pre-book the evening aarti ceremony. After your spiritual visit, trek down to Janki Chatti and drive back to Barkot. Enjoy a delicious dinner and peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Barkot to Uttarkashi – Himalayan Journey
itinerary.description: Rise early, enjoy your breakfast, and check out from Barkot as you proceed to Uttarkashi. This 4-5 hour journey offers spectacular views of the Garhwal Himalayas, lush valleys, and pristine rivers. The drive itself is a spiritual experience, with every turn revealing nature's grandeur. Reach Uttarkashi by afternoon, check into your accommodation, and rest for a while. Uttarkashi, meaning 'Kashi of the north', is home to the revered Kashi Vishwanath Temple. Enjoy a mouthwatering dinner and peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Uttarkashi to Gangotri – Goddess Ganga's Abode
itinerary.description: Wake up early and enjoy your breakfast as you embark on the journey to Gangotri, one of the four sacred Char Dham shrines. The 3-4 hour drive offers serene views of the Bhagirathi River, towering mountains, and verdant valleys. Reach Gangotri town and visit the Gangotri Temple, the highest temple dedicated to Goddess Ganga, built by the Gorkha general Amar Singh Thapa. Offer prayers and take a holy dip at the Gangotri ghat, believed to absolve sins. En route back to Uttarkashi, explore additional scenic destinations like Gangnani (famous for hot springs), Dharali, and Harsil – each offering unique Himalayan beauty. Based on timing, you may stay at Gangnani or return to Uttarkashi. Rejuvenate with a mouthwatering dinner and peaceful sleep.

itinerary.title: Uttarkashi to Guptkashi – Garhwal Himalayan Drive
itinerary.description: Start your day with a satisfying breakfast and continue your Chardham Yatra with a beautiful drive from Uttarkashi/Gangnani to Guptkashi. This 8-10 hour journey through the Garhwal Himalayas is nothing short of spectacular – winding roads, pine forests, gushing rivers, and panoramic mountain views. Enjoy every moment of this ride – listen to devotional music, feel the cool Himalayan breeze, or simply meditate on the divine landscape. Reach Sitapur/Guptkashi by evening, complete check-in formalities, and relax. Enjoy your delicious dinner and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Kedarnath Trek – Lord Shiva's Divine Abode
highlights: Holy dip at Gaurikund hot spring
itinerary.description: After an energizing breakfast, drive to Gaurikund, a 15-20 minute journey. Take a fresh, holy dip at the Gaurikund hot water spring, believed to be where Goddess Parvati meditated to win Lord Shiva. Begin your 14 km sacred trek to Kedarnath – this 6-8 hour journey is the highlight of your yatra. Walk alongside fellow devotees, chanting hymns and absorbing the spiritual energy of the Himalayas. Upon reaching Kedarnath, offer prayers at the ancient Kedarnath Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva and one of the 12 Jyotirlingas. Visit the Shankaracharya Samadhi, the resting place of Adi Shankaracharya. Don't miss darshan at Pitra Kund and Udar Kund. Seek blessings from meditating sadhus near Rama Cave. After this divine experience, return to your stay location, enjoy a mouthwatering dinner, and rest well.

itinerary.title: Kedarnath Descent – Return to Guptkashi
itinerary.description: Wake up early to the divine vibrations of Kedarnath. Enjoy your satisfying breakfast and begin your descent back to Gaurikund. The trek down offers a different perspective of the majestic Himalayas. Upon reaching Gaurikund, our driver will take you back to Sitapur/Guptkashi. Spend the day at your own pace – rest, reflect on your Kedarnath experience, or explore the local surroundings. Enjoy a mouthwatering dinner and rest well.

itinerary.title: Guptkashi to Badrinath – Lord Vishnu's Abode
itinerary.description: Rise early, enjoy a fulfilling breakfast, and check out from Guptkashi. Proceed on your 10-12 hour journey to Badrinath, the final Dham of your Chardham Yatra. The drive through the Alaknanda River valley offers spectacular mountain scenery. By evening, reach the sacred Badrinath Temple, dedicated to Lord Vishnu and part of the 108 Divya Desams. Offer prayers and attend the divine evening Aarti. Feel the spiritual energy of this ancient pilgrimage site, surrounded by the Nar and Narayan mountain ranges. Return to your accommodation, enjoy a delicious dinner, and peaceful overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Badrinath to Rishikesh – Return to the Foothills
itinerary.description: On your second-to-last day, wake up early and enjoy your breakfast. Head back from Badrinath to Rishikesh/Haridwar. This 10-12 hour journey takes you through the ever-changing landscapes of Uttarakhand – from high-altitude Himalayan terrain to lush foothills. Look outside the window, admire the beauty, listen to devotional music, or meditate on your yatra experience. Reach Rishikesh/Haridwar by evening, check into your hotel, and enjoy your mouthwatering dinner. Reflect on your divine journey as you rest for the night.

itinerary.title: Departure – Farewell to the Himalayas
itinerary.description: On the final day of your Chardham Yatra, rise and shine early. Enjoy your fulfilling breakfast and check out from your hotel, carrying beautiful memories, divine blessings, and a heart full of spiritual fulfillment. Our representative will transfer you to the airport or railway station for your onward journey back home. May the blessings of Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath remain with you always.

July to August – Monsoon season, landslides possible, trekking challenging.

keyInfo.title: Climate & Clothing
points: Summer (May-June): 15°C to 25°C – Light woolens, comfortable cottons.
Winter (Nov-Apr): -5°C to 10°C – Heavy woolens, thermal inners, down jacket, gloves, monkey cap.
Monsoon (Jul-Sep): 10°C to 20°C – Raincoat, umbrella, waterproof shoes.
Sturdy trekking shoes with good grip are essential for Yamunotri & Kedarnath treks.
Carry multiple layers – temperature drops significantly at higher altitudes.

keyInfo.title: Trekking Information
points: Yamunotri Trek: 5-6 km one way, 4-5 hours, moderate difficulty.
Kedarnath Trek: 14 km one way, 6-8 hours, moderate to difficult.
Ponies, palanquins, and dolly services available at additional cost.
Start treks early morning to avoid afternoon weather changes.
Carry water, energy bars, dry fruits, and basic medications.
Hire licensed guides for better experience and safety.

keyInfo.title: Connectivity
points: Haridwar, Rishikesh, Dehradun have excellent 4G coverage.
Barkot, Uttarkashi, Guptkashi have decent mobile network (BSNL/Airtel).
Kedarnath and Yamunotri have very limited/no network.
Badrinath has BSNL connectivity.
Inform family and friends about limited connectivity in advance.
Offline maps are highly recommended.

keyInfo.title: Food & Water
points: Uttarakhand cuisine is simple and sattvic, especially near temples.
Must-try: Aloo ke Gutke, Phaanu, Kafuli, Chainsoo, Bal Mithai, Singhauri.
Stick to bottled or filtered water throughout the yatra.
Vegetarian-only food in pilgrimage areas – no alcohol/non-veg near temples.
Eat at recommended or hygienic restaurants and hotel dining areas.

keyInfo.title: Cultural Etiquette
points: Respect local traditions and temple customs.
Dress modestly – cover shoulders and knees, avoid revealing clothes.
Remove shoes before entering temple premises.
Photography is prohibited inside most temples.
Avoid public display of affection near religious sites.
Maintain silence and discipline during aarti ceremonies.

keyInfo.title: Health Precautions
points: Carry motion sickness tablets for winding mountain roads.
High-altitude acclimatization is essential – take it slow on trek days.
Basic medical kit: pain relievers, antiseptic, bandages, ORS, Diamox (after consulting doctor).
Carry personal medications for at least 10-12 days.
Oxygen levels drop at Kedarnath (11,755 ft) and Badrinath (10,279 ft).
Travel insurance is strongly recommended.

keyInfo.title: Local Laws
points: Consumption of alcohol and meat is strictly prohibited in Haridwar, Rishikesh, Badrinath, and Kedarnath.
Smoking is banned in public places.
Avoid plastic use near rivers and forest zones – carry reusable bottles.
Respect wildlife and forest regulations.
Follow temple entry timings and dress codes strictly.

keyInfo.title: Eco-Responsibility
points: Uttarakhand's fragile Himalayan ecosystems need your care.
Say no to plastic – carry reusable water bottles and bags.
Do not litter on treks, temple routes, or river ghats.
Keep Ganga and its tributaries clean – do not offer plastic-wrapped items.
Take only memories, leave only footprints.
Respect the 'Clean Yatra' mission of the Uttarakhand government.

keyInfo.title: Packing Essentials
points: Sturdy waterproof trekking shoes
Warm clothing (layers, fleece, down jacket)
Raincoat/poncho (monsoon season)
Torch/headlamp with extra batteries
Power bank (frequent power cuts in remote areas)
Sunscreen, sunglasses, lip balm
Personal medications and first aid kit
Water bottle (preferably insulated)
Snacks, energy bars, dry fruits, chocolates
Valid ID proof
Pooja samagri (if offering special prayers)
Camera with extra batteries
Walking stick (available locally)

termsAndConditions.title: Health & Fitness

Consult your doctor before booking if you have respiratory or cardiac conditions.

Pregnant women, infants, and individuals with severe health conditions are advised not to undertake this yatra.
Mandatory health screening recommended for elderly pilgrims.

termsAndConditions.title: Travel Insurance
points: Travel insurance is highly recommended for high-altitude pilgrimage.
Insurance should cover medical emergencies, trip cancellation, helicopter evacuation, and personal belongings.
Travel Junky is not liable for any loss, damage, injury, or delay due to unforeseen circumstances.

Chardham Yatra routes often face traffic jams – itinerary flexibility is essential.
Travel Junky reserves the right to alter or cancel any part of the itinerary without prior notice due to circumstances beyond control.
No refunds for missed services or activities due to weather, road conditions, or personal reasons.

termsAndConditions.title: Accommodation

Kedarnath accommodation is basic (camps, dharamshalas, or GMVN) due to high-altitude terrain.
Room allocation is at the discretion of the hotel/lodge management.
Special requests are subject to availability.

Driver's decision on route, stoppage, and timing will be final.
Unscheduled travel or extra stops are not permitted.

termsAndConditions.title: Helicopter Services

termsAndConditions.title: Code of Conduct
points: Travelers must respect local customs, temple traditions, and environmental regulations.
Alcohol, non-vegetarian food, and smoking are strictly prohibited in pilgrimage towns.
Littering, damaging property, or inappropriate behavior may result in removal from the trip without refund.

Maintain discipline during temple darshan and aarti ceremonies.
